text: A traditional dish made with pork seasoned with spices, chili peppers, and herbs, slow-cooked to achieve a rich and hearty flavor. A signature recipe of Tecpan’s celebrations.
Fresh fish prepared with coastal Guerrero flavors, often marinated with garlic, lime, and chili, then grilled or fried. A staple of Tecpan’s seaside cuisine.
Tecpan is known for handmade sweets such as cocadas and tamarind candies, reflecting the creativity and traditions of the Costa Grande region.
